com.smartnsoft.droid4me.cache

Class DbPersistence

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.cache.Persistence
      • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.cache.DbPersistence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Business.InputStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>, Business.IOStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>, Business.OutputStreamer<java.lang.String,Persistence.PersistenceException>

    public final class DbPersistence
extends Persistence
    Enables to store some input streams on a SQLite database.
    Since:
    2009.06.19
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DbPersistence.CacheColumns
      Defined in order to set up the database columns.
      static interface  DbPersistence.DbCleanUpPolicy
      The basis interface for all DbPersistence instances.
      static class  DbPersistence.LastUpdateDbCleanUpPolicy
      A simple clean up strategy, which removes the entries older that a certain of time, which is customizable through the DbPersistence.LastUpdateDbCleanUpPolicy.RETENTION_DURATION_IN_MILLISECONDS field.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FILE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_FILE_NAME
        The default name of the database file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_TABLE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_TABLE_NAME
        The default name of the database table.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FILE_NAMES

        public static java.lang.String[] FILE_NAMES
        The file names of the instances database files.

        The number of elements in this array must be equal to Persistence.INSTANCES_COUNT.

      • TABLE_NAMES

        public static java.lang.String[] TABLE_NAMES
        The table names of the instances database files.

        The number of elements in this array must be equal to Persistence.INSTANCES_COUNT.

      • CLEAN_UP_POLICY_FQN

        public static java.lang.String[] CLEAN_UP_POLICY_FQN
        The fully qualified classes names of the clean up policies to use. Each array element may be null, and in that case, no policy is attached to the corresponding instance.

        The number of elements in this array must be equal to Persistence.INSTANCES_COUNT.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DbPersistence

        public DbPersistence(java.lang.String storageDirectoryPath,
             int instanceIndex)
        See Also:
        DbPersistence(String, int, String, String)

      • DbPersistence

        public DbPersistence(java.lang.String storageDirectoryPath,
             int instanceIndex,
             java.lang.String fileName,
             java.lang.String tableName)
        Creates a persistence instance with all the necessary information to indicate its location.
        Parameters:
        storageDirectoryPath - the directory path where the persistence database should be created
        instanceIndex - the ordinal of the instance which is bound to be created. Starts with 0
        fileName - the name of the database file
        tableName - the name of the table which will handle the persistence
        See Also:
        DbPersistence(String, int)

      • writeInputStreamInstance

        protected java.io.InputStream writeInputStreamInstance(java.lang.String uri,
                                           Business.InputAtom inputAtom,
                                           boolean returnStream)
                                                throws Persistence.PersistenceException
        Description copied from class: Persistence
        Is responsible for performing the #writeInputStream() method job.
        Specified by:
        writeInputStreamInstance in class Persistence
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI which identifies the stream to persist
        inputAtom - the binary form of the data to store for the provided URI
        returnStream - if set true, a valid InputStream corresponding to the provided Business.InputAtom#inputStream must be returned ; if set to false, null must be returned
        Returns:
        null if returnStream is set to false ; if returnStream is set to true, an input stream which holds the same data as the provided inputAtom Business.InputAtom#inputStream
        Throws:
        Persistence.PersistenceException - if a problem occurred while writing the data
        See Also:
        #writeInputStream()

      • computePolicyAndCleanUpInstance

        protected void computePolicyAndCleanUpInstance()
                                        throws Persistence.PersistenceException
        Description copied from class: Persistence
        Is responsible for invoking the Persistence.computeCleanUpPolicy() and then, if the returned value not null, invoke the Persistence.cleanUpInstance(CleanUpPolicy) method.
        Specified by:
        computePolicyAndCleanUpInstance in class Persistence
        Throws:
        Persistence.PersistenceException - if something goes wrong during the Persistence.cleanUpInstance(CleanUpPolicy) method execution

      • computeCleanUpPolicy

        protected <CleanUpPolicyClass extends Persistence.CleanUpPolicy> CleanUpPolicyClass computeCleanUpPolicy()
        The implementation makes use of the CLEAN_UP_POLICY_FQN to decide what clean up policy to use.
        Specified by:
        computeCleanUpPolicy in class Persistence
        Returns:
        a clean-up policy ; may be null, and in that case, the Persistence.computePolicyAndCleanUpInstance() should not run the Persistence.cleanUpInstance(CleanUpPolicy) method
        See Also:
        CLEAN_UP_POLICY_FQN

      • cleanUpInstance

        protected <CleanUpPolicyClass extends Persistence.CleanUpPolicy> void cleanUpInstance(CleanUpPolicyClass cleanUpPolicy)
                        throws Persistence.PersistenceException
        Description copied from class: Persistence
        Cleans-up the persistence.

        This will remove persistent entries depending on the provided cleanUpPolicy.

        Specified by:
        cleanUpInstance in class Persistence
        Parameters:
        cleanUpPolicy - the policy to use for cleaning up the instance
        Throws:
        Persistence.PersistenceException
        See Also:
        Persistence.cleanUp()

      • clearInstance

        protected void clearInstance()
                      throws Persistence.PersistenceException
        Description copied from class: Persistence
        Empties the persistence.

        Once called, the persistence storage will be emptied, but the instance can keep on being used as is.

        Specified by:
        clearInstance in class Persistence
        Throws:
        Persistence.PersistenceException
        See Also:
        Persistence.clear()

      • closeInstance

        protected void closeInstance()
                      throws Persistence.PersistenceException
        This closes the database connection if possible, i.e. when no more instance points to the same database file.
        Specified by:
        closeInstance in class Persistence
        Throws:
        Persistence.PersistenceException
        See Also:
        Persistence.close()
